instructions.title: Quick setup guide
instructions.subtitle: Follow these steps to configure your organization, create geofences, assign personnel, and start tracking.
instructions.tocSubtitle: Use these shortcuts to navigate the guide.
instructions.recommendationBody: Start with 1 geofence and 1 tracker. Once the flow works, scale to more zones and people.
instructions.stepsSubtitle: A practical sequence that works for most organizations.

steps.title: Select your organization
bullets: Use the organization selector to choose where you will work.
If you are Owner, you can create/manage multiple organizations.

steps.title: Create your first geofence
bullets: Go to Geofence and draw the area on the map.
Give it a clear name (Farm A, Field 3, Plant 1, etc.).
Save and verify it appears in Geofences list.

steps.title: Register your personnel
bullets: Go to Personnel and create the people that will work in the field.
Use a valid email if you plan to invite them as trackers.

steps.title: Create activities and hourly rates
bullets: Go to Activities and define tasks (Harvest, Irrigation, Maintenance…).
Set currency and hourly rate to calculate costs and reports.

steps.title: Create assignments
bullets: Go to Assignments and link: Person + Activity + Geofence.

steps.title: Invite trackers (field phones)
bullets: Go to Invite tracker and send an invite by email.
The invited user can log in with Magic Link on mobile.
Once logged in, the tracker will send GPS points based on the assignment.

steps.title: Review reports and dashboard
bullets: Open Reports to filter by geofence/person/activity and export CSV.
Open Costs Dashboard for charts and KPIs.

instructions.bestPractice1Body: Name geofences and activities in a way that your team understands instantly (Farm, Field, Block, Task).
instructions.bestPractice2Body: Validate the full flow with one person and one geofence before creating dozens of records.
instructions.bestPractice3Body: Close or deactivate old assignments so the tracker follows only the current work plan.
instructions.bestPractice4Body: Use a reasonable send frequency. Higher frequency uses more battery and mobile data.
instructions.resultIntro: After completing the steps, your organization should have the following:
resultBullets: At least 1 geofence saved and visible on the map
Personnel registered and ready for assignments
Activities with currency and hourly rate configured
Active assignments linking person + activity + geofence
GPS points appearing in Tracker / Tracking dashboard
Cost reports and dashboard ready to export and analyze

faq.title: Frequently asked questions
faq.subtitle: Quick answers about invitations, roles, tracking, reports, and data privacy.

items.q: How do I get access to the app?
items.a: You need to be invited by an Owner/Admin of an organization. If you don’t have access, request an invitation.

items.q: What is the difference between Owner, Admin and Tracker?
items.a: Owner manages the organization and admins. Admin manages operational data (geofences, personnel, activities, assignments). Tracker is a field user who sends GPS points.

items.q: Can I manage more than one organization?
items.a: Yes. Owners can work with multiple organizations and switch using the organization selector.

items.q: Why do I see “No recent data” in Tracker?
items.a: The tracker may be offline, location permissions may be disabled, or there is no active assignment for that person. Verify permissions and assignments.

items.q: How often does the tracker send location?
items.a: The send frequency is defined in the assignment. The minimum allowed is 5 minutes to protect battery and data usage.

items.q: Does the app work with weak signal?
items.a: Yes. The tracker can store points and sync when connectivity returns (depending on your build and permissions).
Costs are calculated from assignments (hours) and the hourly rate configured for each activity.

items.q: Can I export reports to Excel?
items.a: Yes. Reports can be exported as CSV, which you can open in Excel or Google Sheets.

items.q: Can I filter by geofence, person, activity and date range?
items.a: Yes. Use the filters in Reports and Costs Dashboard to focus on specific geofences, people, activities, and dates.
Only location points needed for tracking and geofence validation. Access is controlled by roles and organization permissions.

items.q: Can trackers see other organizations’ data?
items.a: No. Data is isolated by organization (multi-tenant) and protected by database security rules.
